title: Frank Lampard pays special tribute to Willian after Chelsea's win vs Southampton
text:
Frank Lampard says Willian is an excellent example for Chelsea’s young players (AFP via Getty Images)

Frank Lampard has singled out Willian for special praise after Chelsea’s 4-1 victory over Southampton on Sunday.

Chelsea cruised to a comfortable victory at St Mary’s following goals from Tammy Abraham, Mason Mount, N’Golo Kante and Michy Batshuayi.

But after the match, Lampard gave a special mention to Willian by claiming that the Brazilian is setting a brilliant example for Chelsea’s younger players.

Lampard also said that he felt Willian has been Chelsea’s best player in recent weeks.

‘The balance at the moment is good and that needs to stay and improve,’ said Lampard.

Willian impressed as Chelsea beat Southampton 4-1 at St Mary’s (Getty Images)

‘That comes down to those boys and a lot of them are mates, they came through together.

‘It’s nice for me, it’s great in my position, because the young players, when they’ve got the attitudes that they’ve got, it’s great to coach because they want to improve all of the time.

‘But the experienced players around them… Willian was the standout one today, without a doubt for me.

‘His work ethic off the ball, we talk to the wingers and what we want off the ball we can show them that video of what Willian did today.

‘His quality, his bursts of pace, on the ball what he can do, the last four or five games I think he’s been our best player.

‘And that’s a great thing to say when you’ve got players who are examples on the pitch around these young boys.’
